info.title: IBM Operational Decision Manager Decision Center API
info.description: Explore, build, test, and deploy decision services that are stored in Decision Center

put.summary: Register a webhook to notify other applications of events that are coming from Decision Center
put.description: Provides Decision Center with a URL, and optionally, an authentication token to send data to other applications. If you must provide more than one webhook, you can invoke this endpoint multiple times.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the server to send notifications

schema.description: The authentication token of the remote server

put.summary: Rename a snapshot from a decision service

parameters.name: snapshotId
parameters.description: ID of the snapshot to rename.

parameters.name: newName
parameters.description: New name of the snapshot.

put.summary: Add a target server to use for deployments, simulations, and tests
Create a validation activity in an open release
put.description:
The data required to create the validation activity is provided in JSON payload.
Mandatory fields in the JSON payload:
- Name of the validation activity, which must be unique in the decision service
- Target date of the validation activity
- Name of the owner of the validation activity
Note: If provided, the names of approvers and authors are checked against registered users.

requestBody.description: The JSON payload describing the validation activity to create

put.summary: Create a change activity in an open release
put.description:
The data required to create the change activity is provided in a JSON payload.
Mandatory fields in the JSON payload:
- Nname of the change activity, which must be unique in the decision service
- Target date of the change activity
- Name of the owner of the change activity
Notes:
- If provided, the names approvers and authors are checked against registered users.
- The name of the activity cannot contian any of the following characters: ":*/\<>?

requestBody.description: The JSON payload describing the change activity to create

get.summary: List of the snapshots that are associated with the decision service
get.description: By default, all the snapshots that are associated with the decision service are returned. You can scope the returned list to, for example, a parent release or standard snapshots only,activity, or branch that uses the 'q' parameter. For example: q=parentId:ID_OF_A_PARENT_BASELINE,kind:StandardSnapshot

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to filter objects on their properties. For example: q=name:MyProject

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page. If empty, all elements are returned

put.summary: Create a snapshot of a branch in the decision service
put.description: To create a snapshot, the status of the branch, if any, cannot be 'complete' or 'canceled'.

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the target branch, activity, or release. If none is specified, it defaults to the 'main' branch.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the snapshot to create.

get.summary: List of the releases in the decision service

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to filter objects by their properties. Basic (boolean, number and strings) types only. For example: q=name:MyProject

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page. If empty, all the elements are returned.

put.summary: Create a new release in a decision service
put.description:
The data required to create the release is provided in a JSON payload.
Mandatory fields in the JSON payload:
- Parent ID: the id of the release to start from in the decision service
- Name of the release: must be unique in the decision service
- Target date of the release
- Name of the owner of the release

Notes:
- The target date must be set to a date no earlier than today.- The owner of the release must be a registered user.
- The name of the release cannot include any of the following characters: ":*/\<>?
- If provided, approvers' names are checked against registered users names.

requestBody.description: The JSON payload describing the release to create.

get.summary: List of the branches in the decision service
get.description: Returns only branches, not releases or activities.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to filter objects by their properties. Basic (boolean, number and strings) types only. For example: q=name:MyProject

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page. If empty, all the elements are returned.

put.summary: Create a new branch in a decision service

parameters.name: parentBranchId
parameters.description: Identifier of parent branch where the new branch should get created.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the branch to be created.

parameters.name: documentation
parameters.description: Documentation of the new branch.

parameters.name: allowCreateSharedDep
parameters.description: Use existing branch if any : when this branch name is already used for one of the dependent project of this decision service, using this option allows to reference the existing branch as a dependency of the new branch. False by default

parameters.name: propagateSharedDependencies
parameters.description: When the parent branch includes a dependency to a branch which is shared with an other decision service, this option allows to use this shared dependency with new branch. False by default, meaning that the new branch is created in every dependent project without sharing any dependency.

put.summary: Rename a branch from a decision service

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: ID of the branch to rename.

parameters.name: newName
parameters.description: New name of the branch.

put.summary: Create a new branch from an existing one, and set its parent to the main branch, or the initial release in the case of releases
put.description: Useful when you want to save a branch before you delete its parent branch.By copying a branch, and then checking that its copy works correctly, you can then delete its parent branch without losing the contents of the copied branch.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: ID of the branch to copy.

parameters.name: branchName
parameters.description: Name of the branch you want to create.

put.description: This operation cannot be executed if some projects are already available in the repository

parameters.name: persistenceLocale
parameters.description: Value of persistence locale to store in Decision Center repository

post.summary: Update a webhook to notify other applications of events that are coming from Decision Center
post.description: Update a webhook to notify other applications of events that are coming from Decision Center. Empty values are ignored and do not clear previously set values.

parameters.name: webhookId
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the server to send notifications

schema.description: The authentication token to the remote server

delete.description: Removes a webhook from the list of registered webhooks that are bound to this instance of Decision Center.

parameters.name: webhookId
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook

post.summary: Add or update a user
Run a test suite

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the release, branch, or snapshot to work with. Defaults to the main branch.

parameters.name: deploymentSnapshotName
parameters.description: Name of the deployment snapshot to create or use

get.summary: Details of the server

post.summary: Update a target server to use for deployments, simulations, and tests
post.description: Empty property values are ignored and do not clear previously set values

parameters.name: serverId
parameters.description: The ID of the server

delete.summary: Remove a target server to use for deployments, simulations, and tests

parameters.name: serverId
parameters.description: The ID of the server

get.summary: Retrieve the last configuration file that was uploaded

post.summary: Set the configuration for users, groups and roles
post.description:
Use an XML configuration file to define users, groups and roles
The configuration file has the following structure:
- - Declares a new role.
NOTE: You do not need to upload the predefined roles because they are already present in the Decision Center database.
You can upload new roles.
- - Declares a group and the roles to which the group belongs.
- - Declares a user and the groups to which the user belongs.
- all these declarations should be enclosed between tags.

Example:

parameters.name: eraseAllUsersAndGroups
parameters.description: Erase all existing users and groups, default is false

file.description: xml file that contains users, groups and roles registry mappings

post.summary: Synchronize the repository with any associated LDAP server
post.description: You must have the 'rtsAdministrator' role to perform this action.

get.summary: Details of the release

post.summary: Update an open release of a decision service
post.description:
This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.
Only the provided fields in the JSON payload are used for updating.
An empty field in the JSON payload deletes its corresponding data during an update.
Required fields:
- Name of the release
- Owner of the release
- Target date of the release

Notes: Approvers who are either in ApprovedChanges or RejectedChanges state might not be removed.
The target date of the release cannot be set to a date earlier than today.
The owner of the release must be a registered user.
The name of the release cannot contain any of the following characters: ":*/\<>?

requestBody.description: The JSON payload describing the release to update

delete.summary: Delete an open release in a decision service
delete.description: This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Reopen a release that is canceled or rejected in a decision service
post.description: This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Remove an approver from an open release of a decision service
post.description: This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: approverName
parameters.description: the name of the approver to remove.

post.summary: Reject the open release of a decision service
post.description:
An authenticated approver can reject a release and include an optional comment to explain the rejection.
Note: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can reject the release on behalf of an approver. In this case, the approver's name must be provided as a parameter.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: the name of the user on behalf of whom rejecting the release.

post.summary: Change the owner of an open release of a decision service
post.description:
When this operation is done, only the new owner or an administrator can do owner's tasks in this release.
This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: ownerName
parameters.description: the name of the owner.

post.summary: Cancel an open release in a decision service
post.description: This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Approve an open release of a decision service
post.description:
An authenticated approver can approve a release and include an optional comment to explain the approval.
Note: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can approve this release on behalf of an approver.In this case, the approver's name must be provided as a parameter.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: the name of the user on behalf of whom approving the release.

post.summary: Allow the approval of an open release of a decision service
post.description:
The owner of a release allows the approval of the release when all the release activities are completed.
This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Add an approver to an open release of a decision service
post.description: This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: approverName
parameters.description: the name of the approver to add.

post.summary: Import tab permissions
post.description:
The existing permissions for the tabs are overwritten.
Here is a JSON sample that can be imported:
[
  {
    "tab" : "Model",
    "disabledForGroups" : ["group1", "group2"]
  },
  {
    "tab" : "Reports",
    "disabledForGroups" : ["group1"]
  }
]

Only DecisionArtifacts, Queries, Tests, Simulation, Deployments, Snapshots, Model and Reports tabs are supported for now.

file.description: JSON file that contains the permissions to import

post.summary: Import permissions
post.description:
The existing permissions for the group are overwritten.
Here is a JSON sample that can be imported:
{
  "group": "Eligibility",
  "permissions": [
    {
      "permission": "CREATE",
      "value": "YES",
      "type": "brm.ActionRule"
    },
    {
      "permission": "VIEW",
      "value": "YES",
      "type": "*"
    },
    {
      "permission": "UPDATE",
      "value": "NO",
      "type": "*",
      "feature": "*"
    },
    {
      "permission": "UPDATE",
      "value": "YES",
      "type": "brm.DecisionTable",
      "feature": "name"
    }
  ]
}

The endpoint of effective permissions can be used to find the internal name of a type or feature.

file.description: JSON file that contains the permissions to import

post.summary: Import command permissions
post.description:
The existing permissions for the commands are overwritten.
Here is a JSON sample that can be imported:
[
  {
    "command" : "ExportBranch",
    "disabledForGroups" : ["group1", "group2"]
  },
  {
    "command" : "GenerateReportElement",
    "disabledForGroups" : ["group1"]
  }
]

Only ExportBranch and GenerateReportElement commands are supported for now.

file.description: JSON file that contains the permissions to import

post.summary: Add or update a group
Update dynamic domains

parameters.name: decisionServiceId
parameters.description: ID of the decision service

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the branch. Defaults to the main branch.

parameters.name: bomClassesFQN
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fully qualified names of BOM classes for which you want to update the domain. By default all domains are updated

post.summary: Deploy a RuleApp to an execution server (Rule Execution Server)
post.description:
If no deployment snapshot name is given, a deployment snapshot is created if the deployment configurationhas the 'snapshotMode' attribute set to 'Always'.
If a deployment snapshot name is provided, a deployment snapshot is created with that name if it does not already exist.
This deployment snapshot is then used as the basis for building the RuleApp archive.
The response body contains the deployment snapshot that is created or used, the list of checking messages, if any, and a byte array of the archive if the includeArchive flag is set to false.

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the release, branch, or snapshot to work with. Defaults to the main branch.

parameters.name: deploymentSnapshotName
parameters.description: Name of the deployment snapshot to create or use

parameters.name: rulesetsNewVersions
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of ruleset versions, the format is rulesetName:version (for instance ruleset1:3.0,ruleset2:4.0). If not set, the default version policy is used.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number in the list of errors, if any

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the error page. If empty, all errors are returned.

post.summary: Build a RuleApp for the deployment configuration
post.description:
If no deployment snapshot name is given, a deployment snapshot is created if deployment configuration has the 'snapshotMode' attribute set to 'Always'.
If a deployment snapshot name is provided, a deployment snapshot is created with that name if it does not already exist.
This deployment snapshot is then used as the basis for building the RuleApp archive.
The response body contains the deployment snapshot that is created or used, the list of checking messages, if any, and a byte array of the archive if the includeArchive flag is set to false.

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the release, branch, or snapshot to work with. Defaults to the main branch.

parameters.name: deploymentSnapshotName
parameters.description: Name of the deployment snapshot to create or use

parameters.name: includeArchive
parameters.description: Include the archive byte array in the response. False by default. Don't set this flag for very large files.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number in the list of errors, if any

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the error page. If empty, all the errors are returned.

post.summary: Create a snapshot of a branch in the decision service
post.description: To create a snapshot, the status of the branch, if any, cannot be 'complete' or 'canceled'.

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the target branch, activity, or release. If none is specified, it defaults to the 'main' branch.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the snapshot to create.

post.summary: Import a decision service on top of an existing branch
post.description: The authenticated user must have the 'rtsAdministrator' role to call this endpoint

parameters.name: decisionServiceId
parameters.description: ID of the target decision service

parameters.name: override
parameters.description: Override all the artifacts that have the same ID in the database

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the target branch, activity, or release. If none is specified, it defaults to the 'main' branch.

file.description: Compressed file that contains the decision service to import

post.summary: Import an Excel file into an existing decision table

parameters.name: decisionServiceId
parameters.description: ID of the decision service

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the branch of the decision table. Defaults to the main branch.

parameters.name: decisionTableId
parameters.description: Decision table ID for which you want to import the Excel file in.

parameters.name: dtSheetName
parameters.description: Name of the Excel sheet you want to read the DT from. Defaults to the first sheet.

parameters.name: stopOnWrongNumberOfColumns
parameters.description: Prevent the import if the number of columns doesn't match. True by default.

file.description: Excel file that contains the decision table to import

post.summary: Import a decision service into the repository
post.description:
• The authenticated user must have the 'rtsAdministrator' role to call this endpoint.
  • If a decision service that has the same UUID already exists in the repository, the project elements that do not exist yet in the 'main' branch are imported on top of it. Other elements are simply ignored. If you want to override existing elements or target another branch, use /decisionservices/{id}/import instead

parameters.name: enableDGF
parameters.description: Enable the decision governance framework by creating an 'Initial Release'. This does not apply if the decision service already exists in the database.

file.description: Compressed file that contains the decision service to import

get.summary: Details of the activity

post.summary: Update an activity in an open release
post.description:
Only the provided fields in the JSON payload are used in updating.
An empty field in the JSON payload deletes the corresponding data during the update.
Required fields:
- Name of the activity
- Owner of the activity
- Target date of the activity

Notes:
- Approvers who are either in ApprovedChanges or RejectedChanges state cannot be removed.
- Any authors who contributed to this activity with modifications cannot be removed.
- The target date of the activity cannot be set to a date earlier than today, and no later than the release target date.
- The name of the activity cannot contain any of the following characters: ":*/\<>?

requestBody.description: The JSON payload describing the Activity to update

delete.summary: Delete an activity in an open release
delete.description: This operation can be done by the release owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Resume work in an activity in an open release
post.description:
An author can resume work in an activity after previously finishing it.
Note: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can resume work on behalf of an author. In this case, the authors's name must be provided as a parameter.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: the name of the person on behalf of whom resuming work

post.summary: Reopen an activity in an open release
post.description: This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Remove an author from an activity in an open release
post.description:
The author matching the provided name is removed from the activity's list of authors.
This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: authorName
parameters.description: the name of the author to remove

post.summary: Remove an approver from an activity in an open release
post.description:
The approver matching the provided name is removed from the list of approvers.
This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: approverName
parameters.description: the name of the approver to remove

post.summary: Reject changes of an activity in an open release
post.description:
An authenticated approver can reject an activity and include an optional comment to explain the rejection.
Note: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can reject the activity on behalf of an approver. In this case, the approver's name must be provided as a parameter.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: the name of the user for whom the activity is rejected

post.summary: Finish work on an activity in an open release
post.description:
When done, the author indicates that the work is finished.
Note: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can finish work on behalf of an author. In this case, the authors's name must be provided as a parameter.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: the name of the person on behalf of whom finishing work

post.summary: Change the owner of an activity in an open release
post.description:
The owner of the activity is changed by the user matching the provided name.
This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: ownerName
parameters.description: the name of the owner to change

post.summary: Cancel an activity in an open release
post.description: This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator.

post.summary: Approve changes of an activity in an open release
post.description:
An authenticated approver can approve an activity and includ an optional comment to explain the approval.
Note: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can approve this activity on behalf of an approver. In this case, the approver's name must be provided as a parameter.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: the name of the user on behalf of whom approving this activity

post.summary: Allow approval for an activity in an open release
post.description: The authenticated activity owner or administrator can allow the activity approval after all the authors of activity finish their work.

post.summary: Add an author to an activity in an open release
post.description:
The user matching the provided name is added to the list of authors.
This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator.

parameters.name: authorName
parameters.description: the name of the author to add

post.summary: Add an approver to an activity in an open release
post.description:
The user matching the provided name is added to the list of approvers.
This operation can be done by the activity owner or an administrator

parameters.name: approverName
parameters.description: the name of the approver to add

post.summary: Wipe element version content
post.description: Wipe information from element versions to remove Personally Identifiable Information from history records. This operation cannot be rolled-back, use with care.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The uuid of the element to process

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the element to process. Should match format \<major\>.\<minor\>. Cannot be used if minVersion or maxVersion is used. If version, minVersion and maxVersion are not specified, all versions are processed.

parameters.name: minVersion
parameters.description: The first version of the element to process. Should match format \<major\>.\<minor\>. Cannot be used if version is used. If minVersion is not specified while maxVersion is specified, then minVersion defaults to first version of the element.

parameters.name: maxVersion
parameters.description: The last version of the element to process. Should match format \<major\>.\<minor\>. Cannot be used if version is used. If maxVersion is not specified while minVersion is specified, then maxVersion defaults to last version of the element.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Name of attributes to wipe. Multiple values are supported. If this value is not specified, all supported attributes will be processed.

post.summary: Persist localized messages file
post.description:
Persist a localized message file along with its locale after model extension files are persisted.
Enables the correct display of labels from model extension files.

post.summary: Persist model extension files .brmx and .brdx
post.description:
It is mandatory to persist model extension files to the database,
after the model extension script is run.

post.summary: Run SQL script
post.description:
The authenticated user must have the 'rtsInstaller' role to call this endpoint.
This method launches the specified SQL script file by using a data source.

post.summary: Launch DC database diagnostics generation
post.description: Triggers diagnostics generation

post.summary: Generate an SQL script for model extensions
post.description:
Generate an SQL script from model extension files .brmx and .brdx to alter the schema.
Unless specified,the generated script keeps database data by default.

parameters.name: keepData
parameters.description:
Boolean value (true or false) to indicate to keep existing data in schema.
Defaults to true with an empty value.

post.summary: Stop cleanup operation
post.description: The operation is stopped without waiting for its completion ==> only part of the elements deletion have been executed.

post.summary: Launch cleanup of the repository
post.description: Launch cleanup tool execution to remove old elements from the repository. Since old records will not be available any more after execution, it is recommended to make sure a backup policy is in place prior to using the tool. You must have the 'rtsAdministrator' role to perform this action.

parameters.name: cleanupDate
parameters.description: Date for which data should get deleted (format = yyyy-MMM-dd, with MMM = Jan/Feb/Mar/Apr/May/Jun/Jul/Aug/Sep/Oct/Nov/Dec). All versions older than this date are deleted if they are not the last version for this element.

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: Set dryRun to true in order to generate cleanup report without deleting any record

parameters.name: handleReports
parameters.description: Set handleReports to true in order to cleanup reports (deployment / Simulation / Test)

parameters.name: recyclebinMode
parameters.description: Set recyclebinMode to true in order to drop only old records from recyclebin, by default all versions older than specified date are selected, including deletion versions referenced in the recyclebin

parameters.name: eclassFQN
parameters.description: EClass FQN of specific type to handle, should be one of brm.RuleArtifact, brm.Ruleflow, brm.VariableSet, brm.RulePackage, brm.AbstractQuery, brm.Baseline, brm.BOM, brm.BOM2XOMMapping, brm.DecisionModel, brm.Vocabulary, brm.Template, brm.ScenarioSuite, brm.Resource, brm.EventElement, dsm.Deployment, dsm.Operation, dsm.DSDeploymentReport, validation.Metric, validation.KPI, validation.SimulationModel, validation.SimulationConfiguration, validation.SimulationReport, validation.InputData, validation.TestSuite, validation.TestReport, validation.TestCase

get.summary: Get a list of the webhooks that are bound to this instance of Decision Center

get.summary: List of elements returned by a query

get.summary: Retrieve the effective permissions for one or more groups to JSON
get.description:
The effective permissions are computed assuming the security is enforced.
The returned JSON contains the effective permissions for every available type and feature.
This endpoint can be used to find the internal name of a type or feature to write custom JSON-based permissions.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of groups for which you want the effective permissions.

get.summary: Details of the deployment configuration

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the target branch, activity, release, or createSnapshot. If none is specified, it defaults to the 'main' branch.

get.summary: Download the RuleApp archive for the deployment configuration
get.description:
If no deployment snapshot name is given, a deployment snapshot is created if the deployment configurationhas the 'snapshotMode' attribute set to 'Always'.
If a deployment snapshot name is provided, a deployment snapshot is created with that name if it does not already exist.
This deployment snapshot is then used as the basis for building the RuleApp archive.
The response body contains the deployment snapshot that is created or used, the list of checking messages, if any, and a byte array of the archive if the includeArchive flag is set to false.

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: ID of the release, branch, or snapshot to work with. Defaults to the main branch.

parameters.name: deploymentSnapshotName
parameters.description: Name of the deployment snapshot to create or use

parameters.name: includeXOMInArchive
parameters.description: Includes the XOM in the archive when set to true.

delete.summary: Delete a branch from a decision service

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: ID of the branch to delete.

get.summary: Get system, product, and database information
Get the run status of the SQL script
get.description:
Returns the status of the SQL script run for this data source.
The status might be SUCCESS or RUNNING, in which case the statement contains the running statement, or FAILURE, in which case the statement contains the failed statement and errorMsg the error message.
No authentication is needed to use this method because it does not have to connect to Decision Center.

get.summary: Retrieve model extension files as file archive
get.description:
Get all current model extension related files in an archive: model extension, data extension and localized messages files
If no schema exists, all default files will be provided in the archive.

get.summary: Generate a migration role
get.description:
The authenticated user must have the 'rtsInstaller' role to call this endpoint.
This method generates an SQL script to set up database privileges to migrate 8.6 or later to the current release.

parameters.name: oldSchemaName
parameters.description: Name of database schema in which the Decision Center repository to migrate is available

get.summary: Generate migration script
get.description:
The authenticated user must have the 'rtsInstaller' role to call this endpoint.
This method generates a migration script to migrate 8.6 or later to current release.

parameters.name: oldSchemaName
parameters.description: Name of the database schema in which the Decision Center repository to migrate is available

get.summary: Get DC database diagnostics results
get.description: Retrieve the diagnostics results if available. Running diagnostics are returned with a dedicated status

get.summary: Check cleanup execution
get.description: Returns status information with isRunning flag set to true if a cleanup operation is launched for this datasource.

get.summary: Export report for last cleanup operation to JSON
get.description: Get report on cleanup operation launched for this url and datasource. Partial report is returned if operation is not completed yet.

get.summary: Export old cleanup reports to JSON
get.description: Get reports on cleanup operations launched for this url and datasource. Information about currently running operation or last run is available using /v1/DBAdmin/cleanup/report, whereas this endpoint will return a list of previous executions reports.

delete.summary: Discard all the built states of branches, releases, activities, and snapshots
delete.description: Discard all the built states for branches, releases, activities, and snapshots, namely in baselines. All baselines are rebuilt from scratch. If you provide a baselineId, only built states for this baseline are discarded.

parameters.name: baselineId
parameters.description: The ID of the branch, release, activity or snapshot to clean

alternateURL.description:
The URL of the server to present to users instead of the value of the property url.
If no URL is provided, the value of the property url is set.

production.description:
If true, the server is tagged for production.
The property is only consumed by Rule Designer where the production tag is set on servers.On Decision Center, the production tag is set on deployment configurations.

builtIn.description:
If true, the server was created based on a configuration file during the setup of Decision Center.
For servers created in Business console or with the dedicated REST API, the property is set to false
